Title:
Two new agarics found in Yunnan Province, southwestern
China
Keywords:
Marasmiaceae, Omphalotaceae, phylogeny, taxonomy,
wood-decaying fungi
Abstract:
Two new small agarics found in Yunnan Province,
southwestern China, Marasmius yunnanensis and Marasmiellus
brevistipitatus, are described and illustrated using morphological
characteristics and rDNA ITS sequences. Marasmius yunnanensis is
characterized by its semicircular to subround basidiocarps,
plicate-reticulate pileus, interwoven lamellae, a monomitic hyphal
system, pileipellis cells and cheilocystidia in the form of broom-cells
of the Rotalis-type, and ellipsoid basidiospores measuring 810 × 56.2
μm. Marasmiellus brevistipitatus is characterized by its yellow to pale
yellow basidiocarps, gregarious on dead bamboo, intervenose lamellae
which is concolorous with the pileal surface, a monomitic hyphal system
and ellipsoid basidiospores measuring 68.3 × 34.3 μm
